app package¶

Submodules¶

app.database module¶

class app.database.SalesTable(url: str, key: str)¶

Bases: object

Manages the sales (purchases) database table.

Attributes:

client (Client): The Supabase client for interacting with the database. table (SyncRequestBuilder): The purchases table for database queries.

get_purchases() → List[dict]¶

Retrieves all purchase records from the database.

Returns:

A list of purchase records, or an empty list if no records are found.

Return type:

List[dict]

Raises:

Exception – If the database query fails.

Notes:

Logs any exceptions encountered during the database query.

record_purchase(purchase: Purchase)¶

Records a new purchase in the database.

Parameters:

purchase (Purchase) – The Purchase object containing purchase details.

Returns:

The response data from the database after the record is inserted.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

Exception – If the purchase could not be recorded in the database.

Notes:

Logs the purchase details being added and any exceptions encountered.

Fetches all purchase records from the database.

Returns:

async app.main.health_check()¶

Health check endpoint to verify that the service is operational.

Returns:

A simple status message.

Return type:

dict

async app.main.purchase_good(customer_username: str, good_id: int)¶

Processes the purchase of a good by a customer.

Parameters:

  • customer_username (str) – The username of the customer making the purchase.

  • good_id (int) – The ID of the good being purchased.

Returns:

A confirmation of the successful purchase or an error message.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If a ValueError occurs (status code 400) or a general exception occurs (status code 500).

app.models module¶

class app.models.Purchase(*, good_id: int, customer_id: str, amount_deducted: Annotated[float, Ge(ge=0)], time: str | None = None)¶

Bases: BaseModel

Represents a purchase made by a customer.

Attributes:

good_id (int): The ID of the good being purchased. customer_id (str): The ID of the customer making the purchase. amount_deducted (float): The amount deducted for the purchase. Must be non-negative. time (Optional[str]): The timestamp of when the purchase was made. Defaults to None.

amount_deducted: float¶
customer_id: str¶
good_id: int¶

This replaces Model.__fields__ from Pydantic V1.

app.service module¶

app.service.deduct_inventory(good_id: int)¶

Deducts one unit from the inventory stock of a specific good.

Parameters:

good_id (int) – The ID of the good to deduct stock for.

Returns:

Response from the inventory service.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

ValueError – If the good is not found, stock is zero, or the request fails.

app.service.deduct_wallet_balance(customer_username: str, amount: float)¶

Deducts the specified amount from a customer’s wallet.

Parameters:

  • customer_username (str) – The username of the customer.

  • amount (float) – The amount to deduct from the wallet.

Returns:

Response from the customer service.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

ValueError – If the customer is not found, insufficient funds, or the request fails.

app.service.fetch_good_details(good_id: int)¶

Fetches details of a specific good from the inventory service.

Parameters:

good_id (int) – The ID of the good to fetch details for.

Returns:

Details of the good as a dictionary.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

app.service.process_purchase(customer_username: str, good_id: int)¶

Processes the purchase of a good by a customer.

Parameters:

  • customer_username (str) – The username of the customer making the purchase.

  • good_id (int) – The ID of the good being purchased.

Returns:

A success message confirming the purchase.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

ValueError – If any error occurs during the purchase process.
